Developer Experience (DX)

Outline (Developer Experience (DX))

  1. Developer Experience (DX) [4]
  2. Agent Experience (AX) [3]
Developer Experience (DX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(4) The Rise of DX

  • 2000s: Having any API is good
  • 2010s: Having many APIs is good
  • 2020s: Having good APIs is good


Developer Experience (DX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(5) API Developers

  • A lot of API-related experience and context
  • Discovering APIs at design time for writing applications
  • Navigating the API landscape with all their human skills


Developer Experience (DX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(6) Developer Superpowers

  • Developers resolve naming inconsistencies
  • Developers search, guess, test, troubleshoot
  • Developers understand business workflows through experience
  • Developers catch many mistakes the API design team made


Developer Experience (DX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(7) Do Your DX Homework

  • Most API descriptions need quality improvements anyway
  • Better descriptions benefit everyone, not just AI agents
    • Complete and meaningful operation summaries
    • Comprehensive examples for all operations
    • Clear error handling
    • Consistent terminology and naming
  • Good DX is the foundation for good AX


Agent Experience (AX)

Outline (Agent Experience (AX))

  1. Developer Experience (DX) [4]
  2. Agent Experience (AX) [3]
Agent Experience (AX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(9) Agentic API Users

  • Little knowledge of API patterns and practices
  • Discovering APIs at run-time for solving tasks
  • Navigating only machine-readable parts of the API landscape


Agent Experience (AX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(10) Now There's AX Homework, Too

  • AI agents need information developers don't typically require:
    • Everything that developers usually just know
    • Treat every API like an external one for developers with no context
  • OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) might add AX-specific fields
  • Until then, leverage description fields strategically


Agent Experience (AX) Erik Wilde: From Developer Experience (DX) to Agent Experience (AX)

(11) The OpenAPI Initiative (OAI)

  • Today: no AX-specific fields in OpenAPI (3.2)
  • Community needs to define what AI agents need (3.3)
  • Tooling will follow once fields are standardized
  • Interested? Join the discussion in the OpenAPI Initiative [https://openapis.org]!
